feed.title: Combined summary - Building from git on OSX

entry.title: Combined summary - Building from git on OSX
entry.summary: Gavin Andresen sent a message on the Bitcoin-development mailing list regarding libtool, a new dependency for those building on OSX. He suggested using either 'brew install libtool' or 'port install libtool' and to refer to doc/build-osx.md for all dependencies. Additionally, he provided his configuration options for development purposes. If you're building on OSX and have trouble with the new dependency, libtool, after updating to git HEAD, Gavin Andresen suggests installing it via homebrew (brew install libtool) or port (port install libtool). The full list of dependencies can be found in doc/build-osx.md. After installing libtool, run ./autogen.sh and configure with your desired options. In his case, Gavin uses "./configure --disable-hardening --disable-silent-rules CXXFLAGS='-g3 -O0 -DDEBUG_LOCKORDER'".
